humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " hand " and " xi ", the original meaning is placement. "Shuowen": "Zhiye. Congshou, Xisheng." "The Analects of Confucius-Zilu": "If the penalty is not met, the people will be at a loss."

" Measures " can also mean discarding or shelving. "Book of Rites‧The Doctrine of the Mean": "There is Buddhism, the study of Buddhism, and Buddhism measures." Kong Yingdashu: "Measures, puts it. The study of speech is not enough. If you don't deal with it, you must wait for what is possible."

" Measures " can also mean implementation and application. "Yi·XiCi": "Pushing and acting is called the Tong, and the people of the world are called the cause." Gao Heng's Note: "Measures, Shi Ye."

" Measures " can also mean establishment and formulation. Song Wang Anshi "Reward Wang Zhan Uncle on Jiangdong's Visit to the Pros and Cons of the Tea Law": "Those who have heard of the ancients, the Tsao Fayi will follow."

" Measures " also means raising. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 1: "It's just that there is nothing to do with luggage and travel expenses now."

humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「昔」聲，本義為安放。《說文》：「置也。从手，昔聲。」《論語‧子路》：「刑罰不中，則民無所措手足。」

　　「措」也可表示棄置、擱置。《禮記‧中庸》：「有弗學，學之弗能，弗措也。」孔穎達疏：「措，置也。言學不至於能，不措置休廢，必待能之乃已也。」

　　「措」也可表示施行、運用。《易‧繫辭上》：「推而行之謂之通，舉而措之天下之民謂之事業。」高亨注：「措，施也。」

　　「措」還可表示設立、制訂。宋王安石〈酬王詹叔奉使江東訪茶法利害見寄〉：「余聞古之人，措法貽厥後。」

　　「措」亦表示籌集。《紅樓夢》第1回：「只是如今行李路費，一概無措。」
